variables.example: These items are kept in inventory in the storeroom and contribute to the value of the storeroom
variables.pattern: These items are kept in inventory in the storeroom and contribute to the value of the storeroom
variables.name: STOCKEDDESC

variables.example: These items are not kept in inventory but can be referenced on a job plan as parts to buy as needed for a job.  These items may have a value in the database but do not contribute to the value of the storeroom.
variables.pattern: These items are not kept in inventory but can be referenced on a job plan as parts to buy as needed for a job.  These items may have a value in the database but do not contribute to the value of the storeroom.
variables.name: NONSTOCKEDDESC

variables.example: These items are kept in inventory in the storeroom but do not contribute to the value of the storeroom.  These items are often known as “free issue”.  This means that you do not have to “checkout” these stock items, you just walk up to bins that are usually kept outside the storeroom and freely take what you need.   Examples of these types of items include things like nuts, bolts, nails, etc.
variables.pattern: These items are kept in inventory in the storeroom but do not contribute to the value of the storeroom.  These items are often known as “free issue”.  This means that you do not have to “checkout” these stock items, you just walk up to bins that are usually kept outside the storeroom and freely take what you need.   Examples of these types of items include things like nuts, bolts, nails, etc.
variables.name: EXPENSEDDESC
